ui.tui

Class TUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.tui.TUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class TUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Created by erik.huizinga on 27-1-17.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start a TUI to play a game of Go.
        Parameters:
        args - the input arguments; none are supported.

      • mainMenu

        private void mainMenu()
        Print and handle the main menu.

      • exitMenu

        private void exitMenu()
        Exit the TUI.

      • localMenu

        private void localMenu()
        Print and handle the local game menu. A local game is not played over a Client-Server interface.

      • netMenu

        private void netMenu()
        Print and handle the network game menu. A network game is played over a Client-Server interface.

      • zeroPlayerMenu

        private void zeroPlayerMenu()
        Print and handle the zero player game menu. A zero player game is played locally between two computer players.

      • singlePlayerMenu

        private void singlePlayerMenu()
        Print and handle the single player game menu. A single player game is played locally between a human player and a computer player.

      • twoPlayerMenu

        private void twoPlayerMenu()
        Print and handle the two player game menu. A two player game is played locally between two human players.

      • changePlayerNameMenu

        private void changePlayerNameMenu(java.lang.String currentName,
                                  TUI.MenuAction setPName,
                                  TUI.MenuAction randomName,
                                  TUI.MenuAction previousMenu)
        Print and handle the change player name menu.
        Parameters:
        currentName - the current name.
        setPName - the MenuAction pointing to the method to set the correct player's name field.
        randomName - the MenuAction pointing to the method to generate a random name for this type of Player.
        previousMenu - the previous menu.

      • acceptPlayers

        private void acceptPlayers(Player player1,
                           Player player2,
                           TUI.MenuAction previousMenu)
        Accept the player configuration from a previous menu, store two appropriate Player instances and continue to the board configuration menu.
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first (black) Player.
        player2 - the second (white) Player.
        previousMenu - the previous menu.

      • boardMenu

        private void boardMenu(TUI.MenuAction previousMenu)
        Print and handle the board configuration menu.
        Parameters:
        previousMenu - the previous menu.

        private void handleChoices(java.lang.String prompt,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> choiceNumbers,
                           java.lang.String[] choiceStrings,
                           TUI.MenuAction[] menuActions)
        Handle the specified menu choices.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt to display to the user.
        choiceNumbers - the numbers of the choices.
        choiceStrings - the strings of the choices.
        menuActions - the actions of the choices.

      • readPromptWithLimitedChoices

        private java.lang.String readPromptWithLimitedChoices(java.lang.String prompt,
                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> choices)
        Prompt a user for input with a limited set of legal input choices. If illegal input is given, the user is prompted again until legal input is given.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt to display.
        choices - the List<String> of legal choices.
        Returns:
        the choice, an element of mainMenuChoices.

      • readPrompt

        private java.lang.String readPrompt(java.lang.String prompt)
        Read input by prompting the user.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt.
        Returns:
        the input.
